title: Top 100 MLB prospects for 2026: This year's No. 1 is in a tier of his own
content: Where do stars of tomorrow such as Konnor Griffin and Kevin McGonigle land as we rank baseball's best young players?

title: Mensah, Duke settle dispute as QB eyes Miami
content: Darian Mensah and Duke have agreed to a settlement of their dispute that will clear the way for the quarterback to transfer to another school.

title: Source: Commanders to hire Vikes' Jones as DC
content: The Commanders are finalizing a deal to hire Vikings pass game coordinator Daronte Jones as their next defensive coordinator, a source said.

title: No. 1 Arizona survives BYU to stay undefeated
content: Brayden Burries scored 29 points and made the game-saving block in the final seconds as No. 1 Arizona held off a furious rally from No. 13 BYU.

title: Gauff caught in 'private' moment smashing racket
content: Coco Gauff, a 3-seed and two-time major winner, struggled with her serve and recorded five double faults in the first set, when she was broken four times, and was ousted by Elina Svitolina.

title: Win moves Alcaraz closer to career Grand Slam
content: In his first semifinal in Australia, Carlos Alcaraz will next take on Alexander Zverev after getting past Alex de Minaur on Tuesday.

title: Bediako hearing delayed; NCAA wants new judge
content: Charles Bediako can continue playing for Alabama after a hearing on his request for a preliminary injunction was delayed. Meanwhile, the NCAA has filed a motion asking the judge overseeing the case to recuse himself, AL.com reported.

title: Reports: ICE agents to have security role at Milan
content: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents will have a security role during the Winter Games in Milan, according to multiple reports Tuesday.

title: Ex-FIFA prez backs call to 'stay away' from WC
content: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter on Monday backed a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration at home and abroad.

title: üèà Connelly's top 100 games of 2025 CFB season
content: From CFP (and FCS playoff) classics to OT thrillers and what-the-heck moments, this season had it all.

title: Four offseason lessons from two unlikely Super Bowl teams: Savvy moves for the Seahawks, Patriots
content: It's easy to be skeptical about big free agency spending, midtier QB contracts and defensive-minded coaches. But the Seahawks and Patriots proved everyone wrong.

title: First look at Seahawks-Patriots: Early Super Bowl picks, big questions, key matchups
content: Ahead of the Feb. 8 showdown, we have predictions, matchup insight, looming questions and team breakdowns.

title: Bobby Marks' NBA trade deadline guide: What to know about all 30 teams
content: What deals could kick-start the NBA trade deadline? Bobby Marks examines the players, picks and priorities you need to know for all 30 teams.

title: What went wrong for Coco Gauff at the Australian Open
content: Elina Svitolina was able to upset No. 3 Coco Gauff in less than an hour on Tuesday night at the Australian Open. Here's how she did it.

title: Women's Bracketology: How a new metric will help (or hurt) bubble teams
content: Understanding wins above bubble helps explain why Virginia, which has a 37 NET ranking, is on the outside looking in.

title: Sizing up Stafford vs. Maye for MVP: Which star quarterback should win the award?
content: It's a two-player race for NFL MVP. We made cases for quarterbacks Matthew Stafford and Drake Maye to win the award -- then our experts made their picks.

title: Inside Sean Payton's fourth-down Patriots-Broncos call
content: Behind the scenes with Denver Broncos coach Sean Payton, before and after his failed fourth-down decision.

title: The three key factors that helped the Avalanche turn into a juggernaut
content: Colorado is flirting with NHL records for team performance. We dive deep on the NHL's most dominant team.

title: WWE 'Raw' results: Finn Balor attacks CM Punk, Bron Breakker returns
content: Andreas Hale breaks down all the action from the last episode of "Raw" before Saturday's Royal Rumble.

title: The Premier League stars who could still move this transfer window
content: There is less than a week to go in the January transfer window. Here are the Premier League players who still need a move away this month.

title: What it's really like for a player switching clubs in the January transfer window
content: Former Man City defender reveals how the transfer window can be full of uncertainty, selfishness and betrayal.

title: How Premier League clubs turned into corporations and replaced 'managers' with 'head coaches'
content: Premier League clubs are corporations that have outgrown the "manager" role that legendary Arsenal and Man United clubs once had. Why?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Cole Palmer open to Man United move
content: Cole Palmer, who is reportedly homesick in London, is open to a move to Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Fantasy baseball: Quartet of shortstops leads top-10 prospects to consider for 2026
content: Eric Karabell outlines the prospects most likely to have an impact on the 2026 fantasy baseball season.

title: Get ready for the Senior Bowl: Six predictions and 15 NFL draft prospects to watch in Mobile
content: Our NFL draft experts weigh in on what to expect at the Senior Bowl, from picking out position groups to watch to predicting players who could rise.

title: Benny the Bull picks new number after Derrick Rose's No. 1 jersey retirement
content: Benny the Bull had worn No. 1 since 1969. In honor of Derrick Rose's jersey retirement, the beloved mascot decided to enter a new era.

title: Ranking this weekend's fights: From Lopez-Shakur to Zayas-Baraou
content: Nick Parkinson ranks the weekend's fights from best to worst and breaks down what's at stake in each matchup.

title: 'Bonjour!': UK's Starmer Pokes Fun At Macron By Sporting Sunglasses
content: Britain's Keir Starmer has become the latest world leader to gently mock French President Emmanuel Macron for wearing sunglasses at Davos, donning a pair of aviator shades at a comedy event.

title: Mumbai Woman, Infant Run Over By School Bus, Granddaughter Has Narrow Escape
content: A horrific accident occurred in South Mumbai's Khetwadi area on Tuesday when a school bus ran over a woman and a nine-month-old who was in her arms. The infant died on the spot while the woman suffered severe injuries.

title: When India Pledged Gold To Survive 1991 Forex Meltdown
content: In the early 1990s, India was gripped by a balance-of-payments crisis. The situation was triggered by a slowdown in inward remittances and a sharp rise in oil prices following Saddam Hussein's invasion of Kuwait.

title: 4K QLED Screens, Wireless Charging: Air India Unveils First Boeing 787-9
content: Air India unveiled its first line-fit Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner, with exclusively designed interiors as part of the airline's ongoing transformation under Tata ownership.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Shashi Tharoor Congress - And Rahul Gandhi - Can't Quite Understand
content: The Congress has historically struggled to accommodate autonomous power centres that do not derive legitimacy from its central leadership structure. Placed against this historical arc, Tharoor's predicament acquires sharper relief.

title: Does The India-EU 'Mother Of All' Trade Deal Spell Trouble For Donald Trump?
content: Although the deal was 20 years in the making, the return of US President Donald Trump had accelerated the need to seal the deal.

title: Endangered Caracal Rescued In Rajasthan, Radio-Collared For First Time
content: Following the rescue, the male caracal was radio-collared for the first time and released back into the wild, allowing wildlife officials to track and study this elusive species.

title: "I Owe Money For Milk, Take It From My Purse": Teacher Dies By Suicide In Bihar
content: A teacher in a government school allegedly died by suicide at her home in Bihar's Vaishali district, leaving behind a note apologising to her parents and requesting that her funeral pyre be lit by her three-month-old daughter and not her husband.

title: Halwa Ceremony Marks Final Stage Of Union Budget Preparation
content: The Halwa ceremony, marking the final stage of the Budget preparation process for Union Budget 2026-27, was held today in the Budget Press at North Block, in the presence of Union Minister for Finance and Corporate Affairs Nirmala Sitharaman.

title: Nagpur Student Killed By Neighbour Over Rejection. Murder Staged As Suicide
content: The investigation revealed that Prachi's neighbour, Shekhar Ajabrao Dhore, was in love with her, but she had rejected his advances.

title: "Stop Undermining Peace": China Vows 'Support' For Cuba After US Threats
content: China promised on Tuesday to provide Cuba with "support and assistance" in the face of repeated threats from the United State, which weeks ago removed Havana's ally in Venezuela Nicolas Maduro.

title: Greenland's Melting Ice Transforming Geography Faster Than Diplomacy
content: Greenland ranks eighth globally in rare earth reserves, hosting two of the world's largest known deposits.

title: India To Be Among Important Semiconductor Nations By 2035: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: India will create its own Intellectual Property (IP) in six critical systems, including compute, RF, networking, power, sensor, and memory, through the India Semiconductor Mission, said Union Minister for Electronics and Information Technology.

title: Union Budget 2026: Traditional Halwa Ceremony And Its Significance
content: Days before Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman presents the Union Budget, a small yet significant ritual takes place behind closed doors of the Finance Ministry - the Halwa Ceremony.

title: 2-Year-Old Among 7 Injured In Mumbai Gas Cylinder Blast
content: A toddler and six other persons were injured when a gas cylinder exploded in Mumbai's Malad area on Tuesday morning, officials said.

title: Von Der Leyen Praises Piyush Goyal For Making "Mother Of All Deals" Possible
content: President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen had special praise for India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal for playing a key role in the just-finalised India-EU Free Trade Agreement.

title: "They Want To Make A Deal, I Know So":  Trump Says Iran Wants Talks
content: AUSnaval strike force led by anaircraftcarrierwas in Middle Eastern waters on TuesdayasIranvowed to hit back against any strike and President DonaldTrumpsaid he believed the Islamic republic still wantedtalks.

title: After Free Trade Deal, 99% Of India Goods To Get Preferential Entry Into EU
content: With the India-EU trade deal, the country has secured unprecedented market access for more than 99 per cent of Indian exports by trade value to the EU that also bolsters the Make in India' initiative, the Commerce Ministry said on Tuesday.

title: Luxury Cars, Wines, Medicines: What Will Be Cheaper After India-EU Pact
content: The sealing of the Free Trade Agreement between India and the European Union after an 18-year wait will bring joy to many, connoisseurs of wine and whiske, and automobile enthusiasts, among them.

title: India-EU FTA: Can 'mother of all trade deals' offset impact of Trump's tariffs? Explained
content: Once operational, around 93% of India‚Äôs exports are set to gain duty-free entry into European markets, while Indian consumers are likely to see lower prices on premium European imports such as luxury automobiles and wines. With the US as one of the largest trading partners of India, Trump‚Äôs 50% tariffs have dented its exports.

title: 'I won't stop making music': Arijit Singh announces retirement from playback singing
content: In a move that has sent shockwaves across the music industry, superstar singer Arijit Singh has announced his retirement from playback singing. The much-loved vocalist revealed that he will no longer take up any new assignments as a playback singer.

title: Threads of partnership: EU President Ursula and PM Modi twin in Eri silk scarf
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen gained social media attention for twinning in traditional Eri silk scarves during her India visit. The visit also saw the announcement of a landmark India-EU Free Trade Agreement, hailed as the 'mother of all deals,' aiming to deepen economic ties and create a vast free trade zone.

title: Jos Buttler scripts history, becomes only the second player to‚Ä¶
content: Jos Buttler achieved a significant milestone, becoming the second England player to play 400 international matches during the third ODI against Sri Lanka.  The wicketkeeper-batter has amassed over 12,000 international runs, solidifying his status as a key white-ball player. Buttler is also slated to participate in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026.

title: Tamil Nadu assembly election: Can Vijay's TVK convert fan frenzy into votes?
content: Actor Vijay's foray into Tamil Nadu politics with his party TVK mirrors past celebrity transitions, but his decision to quit films entirely sets him apart. While his fan base is large and organized, the success of TVK hinges on converting this popularity into votes, a challenge that has tripped up other stars.

title: Report claims Trump admin planning to use AI to write federal transportation regulations
content: The Trump administration is reportedly exploring AI to draft federal transportation rules, aiming to drastically speed up the process. While proponents highlight efficiency gains, critics express serious concerns about the accuracy and potential dangers of delegating such critical safety regulations to emerging technology. This initiative marks a significant push for AI integration within government operations.

title: 'Moral duty': UP officer quits after Shankaracharya's remarks on PM Modi and CM Yogi
content: A Uttar Pradesh GST Deputy Commissioner in Ayodhya, Prashant Kumar Singh, has resigned citing moral reasons and support for CM Yogi Adityanath and PM Narendra Modi. Singh stated he was deeply hurt by allegations against the leaders and felt it was his duty to take a stand. He plans to engage in social work after his resignation is accepted.

title: 'Turmoil in global environment': PM Modi's 'double engine' pitch after India-EU 'historic' FTA
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced a historic free trade agreement between India and the European Union, emphasizing a "double engine" growth approach amid global turmoil. This "biggest free trade agreement" aims to provide stability and common prosperity, unlocking new opportunities for India's labor-intensive products and service sectors.

title: Microsoft and Amazon together take out a full-page ad; point to 'emergency' in Washington
content: Tech giants Microsoft and Amazon, usually fierce rivals, have united to address Washington State's housing crisis.  The companies jointly penned an Op-Ed and took out a full-page ad, highlighting their $1.6 billion commitment to affordable housing. They urge policymakers to simplify building regulations to combat the severe shortage.

title: 'Drunk driving': Former Indian cricketer rams into parked cars
content: Former India cricketer Jacob Martin was arrested early Tuesday after his SUV crashed into three parked cars in Vadodara. Police allege Martin, 53, was driving under the influence of alcohol when he lost control of his vehicle. The incident, which caused significant damage, has led to a case being registered against the ex-batsman.

title: OpenAI VP Matt Knight shares resignation note on X; CEO Sam Altman replies
content: OpenAI's Chief Information Security Officer, Matt Knight, has stepped down after over five years. Knight, the company's first security hire in 2020, oversaw the growth of its security program to protect a global platform used by millions. He expressed pride in defining AI security and launching the Aardvark project. CEO Sam Altman lauded Knight's significant contributions.

title: U-19 World Cup: Malhotra, Sooryavanshi star as India dismantle Zimbabwe
content: India launched their U-19 World Cup Super Six campaign with a dominant 204-run victory over Zimbabwe. Vihaan Malhotra's unbeaten century anchored a formidable 352/8, supported by Abhigyan Kundu's fluent 61.  Zimbabwe's chase faltered early, succumbing to India's disciplined bowling attack for 148, securing India a commanding start to the next stage.

title: My cat is my dog: Why Trump ally Scott Bessent needs to watch 'Yes, Minister'
content: ‚ÄãBessent‚Äôs argument collapses the moment it is viewed through the prism of logic, because it mistakes activity for responsibility and motion for meaning. When Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine in 2022, India was importing barely 1‚Äì2% of its crude oil from Russia. It was not a factor in the global energy equation at all.

title: BAFTA Awards 2026: Farhan Akhtar-backed Manipuri film 'Boong' gets nominated
content: The Manipuri film 'Boong' has made waves by securing a BAFTA nomination for Best Children's and Family Film, a remarkable milestone for Indian cinema. Under the banner of Farhan Akhtar‚Äôs Excel Entertainment, this coming-of-age tale, directed by Lakshmipriya Devi, narrates the touching journey of a young boy striving to reunite with his father.

title: From academic debate to institutional scrutiny: Inside IIT Delhi‚Äôs caste conference fallout
content: IIT Delhi‚Äôs decision to appoint a fact-finding committee after a controversial conference on caste and race marks a shift from academic debate to institutional reckoning. Sparked by the political reading of one session, the episode now centres on governance, accountability and where India‚Äôs most symbolic technical institutions draw the line between scholarship and reputational risk.

title: After cheating claims by Smriti Mandhana's friend, Palash Muchhal spotted outside court
content: Music composer Palash Muchhal has filed a Rs 10 crore criminal defamation case against Marathi actor-producer Vidnyan Mane. Mane had accused Muchhal of cheating and financial fraud amounting to over Rs 40 lakh, claims the composer refutes as baseless and damaging to his reputation.

title: 'Aye! Who's screaming DK, DK': Sidda loses cool as youth leaders chant DKS slogans
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah lost his temper at a rally when Youth Congress workers chanted slogans for deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Despite his requests for quiet, the disruptions continued, overshadowing the protest against a new rural employment scheme. This incident highlights the ongoing power struggle between the two leaders within the state Congress.

title: Beyond visual range: How meteor & BrahMos defined India's air power during Op Sindoor
content: The Indian Air Force showcased frontline fighter jets armed with advanced missiles like Meteor and BrahMos in Republic Day footage. This display counters claims questioning India's use of high-end weaponry during past operations, confirming the operational deployment of these potent weapon systems.

title: India-EU FTA: Rs 6.4 lakh crore export boost for us, says Piyush Goyal
content: India and the European Union have inked a historic Free Trade Agreement after two decades of talks, boosting bilateral economic ties amid global uncertainty. This comprehensive pact grants India unprecedented market access for over 99% of its exports to the EU, significantly benefiting labour-intensive sectors and MSMEs, while also enhancing services and mobility for professionals.

title: The day Djokovic broke the Federer‚ÄìNadal duopoly ‚Äî and began rewriting tennis history
content: Eighteen years ago, a 20-year-old Novak Djokovic achieved his first Grand Slam title at the Australian Open, ending the Federer-Nadal dominance. This victory marked the start of his record-breaking career, now spanning almost two decades and 24 major titles. Still competing at 38, Djokovic continues to chase further historical achievements.

title: 'He deserves another chance': Ex-India captain's message to Agarkar over Sarfaraz
content: Sarfaraz Khan is making a strong case for a return to the Indian team with exceptional domestic performances after a period of transformation. His recent prolific run-scoring, including a 227 in the Ranji Trophy, has garnered attention. Encouragement from former captain Mohammad Azharuddin, who praised his attacking intent and desire to learn, further bolsters his prospects for another opportunity.

title: BAFTA 2026: 'One Battle After Another' leads; see full list of nominations
content: The excitement is palpable as the 2026 BAFTA nominations have just been announced! Leading the charge is Paul Thomas Anderson's compelling drama 'One Battle After Another' with an impressive 14 nominations, while the intense narrative of Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners' follows closely behind with 13 nods. These awards shine a spotlight on the incredible creativity in both British and international films.

title: 'Remove your perfume & tie your hair': Historian recounts 'strange' experience at this Delhi tomb
content: Historian Eric Chopra explores Delhi's haunted sites, focusing on the enigmatic tomb of Jamali and Kamali.  Despite local warnings of djinns, Chopra experienced a profound sense of peace and love within the tomb, highlighting the enduring power of bonds that transcend death.

title: Protests, PIL and campus pushback: Why UGC's equity rules have opened a can of worms
content: UGC‚Äôs 2026 equity regulations, notified January 13, have triggered student protests from Delhi to Lucknow, political heat, and a Supreme Court PIL targeting Regulation 3(1)(c). It defines caste-based discrimination as discrimination against SC, ST and OBC members. Protesters fear misuse, burden-of-proof issues and ‚Äúsurveillance‚Äù via Equity Squads, while the Centre says misuse won‚Äôt be allowed and clarifications are coming soon.

title: No tariffs on gems, jewellery, plastic: How will ‚Äòmother of all deals‚Äô with EU benefit India ‚Äî Explained
content: The European Union ranks among India‚Äôs largest trading partners. The bilateral trade between the two in goods and services has risen steadily in recent years.

title: India-EU trade deal sealed: Why won't FTA be signed today?
content: India and the European Union have concluded talks for a free trade agreement. This landmark deal promises expanded market access for Indian exports and lower tariffs for EU goods. The agreement will now undergo legal review and ratification. Formal signing is anticipated later this year, with implementation likely in early 2027.

title: Gujarat man escaped from Nepal jail during Gen Z protests; arrested in Ahmedabad
content: An Indian national from Gujarat, Dharmesh Chunara, who escaped from Nepal's Bhadra Jail during last year's "Gen Z" protests, has been apprehended by Ahmedabad Police. He was caught with 13 kilograms of hybrid ganja valued at approximately Rs 13 crore. Chunara had entered India via the Sonauli border after the jailbreak.

title: 'Politics should be eradicated': Ex-Pak cricketer issues blunt warning to world cricket
content: Former Pakistan spinner Saqlain Mushtaq has strongly criticized the intrusion of politics into cricket, asserting it harms both the sport and humanity. He emphasized cricket's role in fostering unity, lamenting the prolonged absence of India-Pakistan bilateral series. Mushtaq believes politics is detrimental, turning cricket into a battleground instead of entertainment.

title: Office romance ends in murder: Lover beheads HR manager, dumps body in gunny bag
content: An HR manager was brutally murdered and dismembered by her lover in Agra. The accused, Vinay Singh, allegedly killed the victim, Minky Sharma, after a dispute over her contact with another man. He confessed to the crime and has been arrested, with efforts underway to recover the victim's head.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 5: Movie inches towards Rs 180 crore
content: Border 2 has achieved exceptional box office success over its opening weekend, driven by strong performances on Saturday, Sunday, and Republic Day. The film garnered a massive Rs 59 crore on Monday, with mass belts and Tier-2/Tier-3 centers showing extraordinary results, leading to a total collection of Rs 179.23 crore in just five days.

title: Union Budget 2026‚Äì27 to be presented on Feb 1: Here‚Äôs when and where to watch
content: Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget for the financial year 2026‚Äì27 in Parliament on Sunday.  It is a statement of the government‚Äôs estimated receipts and expenditures for the coming year.  The budget will be broadcasted live on Sansad TV, DD News and TOI will provide live coverage.

title: 'Can't accommodate ... ': ICC on 80‚Äì90 Bangladeshi applications for T20 World Cup
content: The ICC is revising its media accreditation for Bangladeshi journalists after the team's withdrawal from the T20 World Cup due to security concerns. Several journalists reported rejections, prompting the ICC to rework the process. The Bangladesh Cricket Board is seeking clarification from the ICC on the accreditation changes.

title: India-EU FTA sealed: Will BMWs and Mercedes be more affordable?
content: India's new Free Trade Agreement with the EU promises lower import duties on European cars, potentially making luxury brands more accessible. However, the benefits are primarily for higher-income buyers, as concessions apply to pricier vehicles. While mass affordability for the average middle class remains distant, the deal could spur local manufacturing and technological advancements in India's auto sector.

title: 'You're like Yuvraj Singh': Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's priceless reaction to kid fan goes viral
content: Young batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is making waves at the Under-19 World Cup, recently smashing a 24-ball half-century against Zimbabwe. The Rajasthan Royals prodigy, compared to Yuvraj Singh by fans, has scored 166 runs in four matches, showcasing his explosive and fearless batting.

title: ‚ÄòJust quit ...‚Äô: Rahul opens up on injuries, mental battles & cricket's next chapter
content: KL Rahul acknowledges his career hasn't fully met expectations but has found stability as India's reliable No. 5 ODI batter. He discussed retirement pragmatically, highlighting the mental toll of injuries as the toughest challenge. Rahul emphasised a balanced perspective, especially after becoming a father, seeing life beyond cricket. He's now set for domestic duty with Karnataka.

title: India-EU FTA: European beer, cars and food to get cheaper ‚Äî details of the trade deal
content: India-EU FTA concluded: India and the European Union have finalized a landmark free trade agreement, dubbed the 'mother of all deals,' creating a vast economic zone. This pact promises significant benefits, including cheaper European cars and food for Indians, and duty-free access for Indian textiles and leather. The deal, concluded after 18 years, aims to boost trade and strengthen strategic ties.

title: BJP vs Cong: Rahul stirs row over ‚ÄòGamosa‚Äô at President‚Äôs ‚Äòat home‚Äô reception
content: Both parties trained guns at one another after the BJP alleged that Rahul Gandhi refused to wear the traditional Assamese scarf given to all the guests at a reception hosted by President Droupadi Murmu. BJP called it an insult to the northeast, with Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma snubbing what he called the attitude of the "de facto supremo".

title: UGC rules, Magh Mela snub: What pushed Bareilly city magistrate to quit on Republic Day
content: Bareilly City Magistrate Alankar Agnihotri resigned, citing deep disagreement with UGC regulations he deemed divisive and a threat to academic harmony. He alleged the new rules could foment caste discontent and lead to atrocities against Brahmins. Agnihotri also claimed he was held hostage at the District Magistrate's residence, allegations refuted by the DM. Political leaders expressed concern over administrative pressure.

title: Only two Nipah Virus Disease cases reported in West Bengal since December 2025
content: A total of 196 contacts linked to the confirmed cases have been identified, traced, monitored, and tested. All traced contacts have been found asymptomatic and have tested negative

title: U.P. official quits job to extend support to Yogi Adityanath in Shankaracharya row
content: Prashant Kumar Singh, posted as Deputy GST Commissioner in Ayodhya, sent his resignation to the Governor

title: DMK delegation to meet Rahul Gandhi in New Delhi
content: According to sources in both parties, DMK Parliamentary Party leader Kanimozhi Karunanidhi is set to meet Mr. Gandhi to convey her party high-command‚Äôs offer of seats for the Assembly election

title: Labour unions welcome Karnataka‚Äôs welfare board for Gig workers, seek stronger social security
content: Under the framework notified by the State government, both aggregator platforms and gig workers will¬†be required¬†to register with the welfare board

title: Congress to press MGNREGA, SIR, foreign policy concerns in Budget session; Opposition to meet
content: Environmental concerns, including the redefinition of the Aravalli hills and the Great Nicobar project, would also be flagged the party, Congress leader and Rajya Sabha Whip Naseer Hussain says

title: No discrimination under new UGC equity rules, says Education Minister
content: ABVP says regulations ‚Äúwell-intentioned‚Äù but require ‚Äúclarity and balance‚Äù; NSUI welcomes the regulations

title: Physiotherapists, occupational therapists can use the ‚ÄòDr.‚Äô title, says Kerala HC
content: The court noted that the National Medical Commission Act does not contain any provision conferring the title ‚ÄúDr.‚Äù exclusively on medical professionals

title: EU, India commit to collaboration on ‚Äòpeaceful uses‚Äô of nuclear power
content: Statement also cites ‚Äúdeepening cooperation‚Äù under the EU research and innovation programme, including in the fields of energy, water, agri food, health, semiconductors, biotech, advanced materials

title: Expect a realistic and practical State Budget: Balagopal
content: Finance Minister ‚Äî whose sixth Budget is also the final one of the present LDF government as Kerala moves towards the Assembly elections ‚Äî says his presentation on Thursday will reflect the LDF conviction that it will continue in power in the State

title: New Labour Codes will help protect workers‚Äô interests and boost jobs, says Union Minister
content: Shobha Karandlaje says these reforms will ensure transparency, social security and ease of doing business, calls for strong Centre‚ÄìState coordination

title: BRS leaders meet Governor, urge him to recommend probe into Singareni OB tenders
content: Opposition party flags alleged irregularities in solar power projects, explosives supply in Singareni

title: Railway stations renovation work in Thiruvananthapuram Division to be completed in February, says DRM
content: Besides the renovated Chirayinkeezhu and Kulitturai stations ‚Äì inaugurated by the Prime Minister recently ‚Äì 11 additional stations undergoing renovation will be opened by February

title: Twenty20‚Äôs entry into NDA was not to evade ED case, says Sabu Jacob
content: He say  the ED had issued notice to the company in May last year seeking relevant documents for the last few years since the COVID-19 pandemic as part of the usual procedure to verify whether the entire value of its foreign exports had been realised in India

title: City student among top 100 in Veer Gatha initiative
content: Project Veer Gatha 5.0 encourages students to create projects celebrating the bravery and life stories of gallantry awardees and great Indian warriors

title: FCV tobacco farmers urge rollback of steep excise duty hike
content: Delegation from four districts tells Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu that over 70% increase has hit auctions, prices and rural livelihoods, and fuelled illicit cigarette trade

title: JNCASR and Bengaluru company tie-up for smarter cooling of aviation batteries
content: This collaboration is expected to address critical challenges in drone performance, safety and operational endurance

title: No new housing units permissible on the sites of three demolished Maradu apartments, says KCZMA
content: The apartments were demolished six years ago for violating Coastal Regulation Zone rules;  residential units can be constructed on the property where Golden Kayaloram apartment once stood, says panel

title: Reports of negligence at Vilappil health centre baseless: KGMOA
content: The association calls for strict action against those disrupting the functioning of the health facility

title: Hundreds of daily wage workers take out protest march in Dharwad
content: Repeal Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act, demands All India Kisan Khet Majdoor Sangathan

title: Acquire, auction assets of acid attackers to pay their victims: Supreme Court
content: Acid attacks should result in ‚Äúextraordinary punitive measures beyond the letters of the law‚Äù, says CJI; asks Centre to consider ‚Äúlegislative interventions‚Äù, shift onus to accused; rejects ‚Äúreformative approach‚Äù

title: Political motives force NSS to step back from alliance with SNDP
content: Explaining the decision to withdraw, NSS general secretary G. Sukuaran Nair said the organisation stepped back after realising that a political agenda lay behind the move. He maintains that his call for unity between the two major Hindu community organisations was sincere, but said it later became evident that those who raised the issue of unity were driven by political considerations

title: Fifth Loka Kerala Sabha to begin on January 29
content: Three-day meet will begin with Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurating the public meeting at 5 p.m. at the Nishagandhi auditorium

title: TDP MP flags tobacco crisis, Amaravati status at all-party meet in Delhi
content: Lavu Srikrishnadevarayalu urges debate on GST impact on farmers, highlights Jal Jeevan Mission fund utilisation gap and calls for social media restrictions for under-16s

title: New sub-stations to ensure quality, uninterrupted power supply: A.P. Energy Minister
content: 10-12 more sub-stations will be established in Nellore district to eliminate low-voltage problems, says Gottipati Ravi Kumar

title: SYL canal talks inconclusive as Punjab, Haryana agree to continue dialogue
content: Chief Ministers hold cordial meeting in Chandigarh, decide on further discussions at officials‚Äô level

title: RSC Tirupati opens new Biomimicry gallery
content: Biomimicry is a concept that evaluates biological entities and replicates the same to highlight, design and develop concepts using technological models to benefit humankind

title: 70 Greater flamingos arrive at Hope Island, largest sighting in the estuary
content: The arrival of 70 Greater flamingos is believed to the first time to record on the Hope Island as claimed by the Forest Department

title: VB-G RAM G Act changes are meant to prevent corruption during implementation, says Joshi
content: ‚ÄòCentral govt. is executing Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act as part of its vision for a developed India by 2047‚Äô

title: Award for former DRDO scientist Tessy Thomas
content: She wins the award for  her lifetime contributions and achievements in the area of science and technology.

title: A silent Palestinian play turns absence into testimony
content: Ashtar Theatre‚Äôs wordless play Oranges & Stones tells 75 years of dispossession through movement, memory and music

title: TDP holds training for 1,050 parliamentary committee members
content: Workshop reviews party ideology and cadre management; regional centres planned to strengthen organisational efficiency

title: With flights above ‚Çπ12,000, West Bengal migrants in Bengaluru seek special trains amid SIR travel
content: Estimates by associations suggest that nearly two lakh Bengali migrant workers live in Bengaluru, many yet to travel back to their home districts

title: Punalur braces for seasonal water scarcity as summer sets in
content: Though the town requires approximately 12 million litres of water a day, the existing infrastructure offers a mere 4.5 mld

title: Congress government pursuing holistic approach for sustainable development of urban, peri-urban and rural economic zones in Telangana: Bhatti
content: Deputy CM says Telangana aims to achieve a three-trillion-dollar economy to become globally competitive as per the Vision 2047; calls upon the rank and file of Congress to collectively strive to ensure the victory of party candidates in the civic polls

title: Sivankutty sparks a political row by demanding that SIT question Sonia Gandhi in  Sabarimala gold theft¬†case
content: Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan says General Education Minister  has no moral right to rake up her name, adding the latter‚Äôs words reflects the government‚Äôs desperation in the case

title: Free sand policy a complete fraud, alleges former Minister
content: Coalition leaders are minting over ‚Çπ3 crore a month from each sand reach, alleges YSRCP Nellore district president Kakani Govardhan Reddy

title: Ahead of Budget, Congress points to rising inequality, questions credibility of official data
content: The party‚Äôs Research Department released its annual report, ‚ÄòInequality on the Rise, Welfare in Retreat ‚Äì Real State of the Economy 2026‚Äô, days before the presentation of the Union Budget on February 1

title: More medical seats required: VIT Chancellor
content: The Centre, State governments, courts and Medical Council of India should work together to boost medical education, says G. Viswanathan

title: Southern Railway reopens British-era subway in Arakkonam for public use
content: Built in 1865 by the then Madras Railway, the subway was closed for more than a month to facilitate the laying of two additional railway tracks for express trains

title: Santiago Gimenez interview: World Cup dreams for Mexico, friendship with Pulisic
content: Santiago Gim√©nez is key to Mexico 's plans for the men's world cup . the 24-year-old is in the middle of a fitness battle to be ready for the tournament . he completed a $38 million transfer from Dutch club Feyenoord to Milan in January 2025 .

title: After Clippers' 15-3 run, fan follows through on eating his words
content: the LA Clippers defeated the Brooklyn Nets 126-89 on a 15-3 stretch dating back to December . fans remembered Flom's post on X as soon as the final buzzer sounded . he stayed true to his word, saying he would indeed eat a printout of his post .

title: UCLA's Bob Chesney: Coal miner, bartender, coach of the Bruins
content: new coach Bob Chesney has mined coal, slung Red Bull and vodkas behind a bar . he has worked every on-field job from strength coach to special teams coach . "he's the kind of guy I want to get in the foxhole with," athletic director says .

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Muratalla climbs after IBF title defense over Cruz
content: the lightweights were separated by one punch on CompuBox, but Muratalla appeared to land the harder punches . it was the first time that the lightweight champion fought past 10 rounds in his seven-fight pro career . he moves up to no. 4 from no. 6 in the ESPN lightweight rankings .

title: MLS, Polymarket join forces in prediction markets
content: the NHL became the first major professional U.S. league to announce a deal with prediction markets in October last year . prediction markets such as Polymarket and Kalshi allow users to trade on the yes/no outcome of events .

title: Super Bowl betting buzz: How one bettor's $100 bet could turn into $310,000
content: our super bowl betting buzz file aims to provide fans a look at the sports betting stories leading up to the big game . the matchup for super Bowl LX is set with the Seattle Seahawks favored over the new England Patriots to take home the Lombardi Trophy .

title: MLB's top five breakout teams for 2026: A healthier Braves squad? A bounce-back in Baltimore?
content: a breakout team is a club that wins at least 10 more games than what would be expected by its established level of play . we'll use wins per 162 games for the previous two seasons, while giving double weight to the most recent season . last season, the highest baseline win level was the Los Angeles Dodgers .

title: The two sides of Mitch Marner's return home to Toronto
content: the Toronto Maple Leafs honor Mitch Marner in a tribute video . the star player spent nine seasons with the team . he left his hometown team and joined the Vegas Golden Knacks . marner's car was stolen and his address was leaked online .

title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: South Carolina slips
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the results of a pair of SEC showdowns shuffled the top of the rankings . south Carolina Gamecocks dropped one spot to no. 3 .

title: Wetzel: Let football be football. And let it snow.
content: new England beat Denver 10-7 in the aFC championship game . the teams combined for just 48 fourth-quarter yards and zero points . there was plenty of complaining on social media about how the elements shouldn't impact games of such magnitude . can football still be football and not tinkered with until it is some algorithm-based product .
